name: DartScorer Deluxe
description:
Developed by Trevor Foltz

The Deluxe Version of DartScorer, the Premium app for Dart Enthusiasts is even better now!

New features include sounds, winner notification on 501 and 301 when a player 'doubles-out', and visual indication of scoring entries.

DartScorer Deluxe includes our popular Cricket Scoreboard, plus 501 and 301 scoring, with automatic Out Chart recommendations that can help you determine the quickest way to win a game.

501 and 301 scoreboards automatically switch between players when 3 darts have been entered.

The cricket scoreboard automatically calculates points scored until your opponent closes a number.

To change a player's name, click on 'Player 1' or 'Player 2' (the entry will be propagated to each scoreboard).

To score a Cricket game, use the S (single), D (double) and T (triple) buttons next to the number when your opponent scores. If a player has less than 3 of a number and the opponent continues scoring on that number, the point total is automatically calculated.

To score 501 or 301, switch to the first player to score by using the 'Switch Player' button (their score is shown in yellow). Then enter each scoring dart, such as 'T20' for a Triple 20. The point total will automatically be deducted, and when 3 entries are made, it switches to the next player automatically.

You can undo as many moves as needed, if you make a mistake.

If the remaining score for either player has a 2 or 3 dart 'Out', it is shown under that player's score.
